description:
We can get version ids v2.0 and v2.1 by "get list of versions" like

$ curl -g -i -X GET http://192.168.11.65:8774
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json
Content-Length: 375
Date: Fri, 04 Sep 2015 01:32:25 GMT

{"versions": [{"status": "SUPPORTED", "updated": "2011-01-21T11:33:21Z", "links": [{"href": "http://192.168.11.65:8774/v2/", "rel": "self"}], "min_version": "", "version": "", "id": "v2.0"}, {"status": "CURRENT", "updated": "2013-07-23T11:33:21Z", "links": [{"href": "http://192.168.11.65:8774/v2.1/", "rel": "self"}], "min_version": "2.1", "version": "2.11", "id": "v2.1"}]}
$

and we can get v2.0 version details like:

    $ curl -g -i -X GET http://192.168.11.65:8774/v2.0
    HTTP/1.1 300 Multiple Choices
    Content-Type: application/json
    Content-Length: 453
    Date: Fri, 04 Sep 2015 01:33:36 GMT

    {"choices": [{"status": "SUPPORTED", "media-types": [{"base": "application/json", "type": "application/vnd.openstack.compute+json;version=2"}], "id": "v2.0", "links": [{"href": "http://192.168.11.65:8774/v2/v2.0", "rel": "self"}]}, {"status": "CURRENT", "media-types": [{"base": "application/json", "type": "application/vnd.openstack.compute+json;version=2.1"}], "id": "v2.1", "links": [{"href": "http://192.168.11.65:8774/v2.1/v2.0", "rel": "self"}]}]}


but we cannot get v2.1 version details

    $ curl -g -i -X GET http://192.168.11.65:8774/v2.1
    HTTP/1.1 401 Unauthorized
    Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
    Content-Length: 23
    Www-Authenticate: Keystone uri='http://192.168.11.65:5000'
    X-Compute-Request-Id: req-e6748244-59dc-45c7-9b27-8d00c5918df7
    Date: Fri, 04 Sep 2015 01:34:22 GMT

    Authentication required

even if passing auth, we cannot get anything

    $ curl -g -i -X GET http://192.168.11.65:8774/v2.1 -H "X-Auth-Token: ef3ac6beb4904072bca41111f45ea4f9"
    HTTP/1.1 302 Found
    Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf8
    Location: http://192.168.11.65:8774/v2.1/
    X-Compute-Request-Id: req-2c38f680-cd51-45a0-bd04-47e3b09ff9e8
    Content-Length: 0
    Date: Fri, 04 Sep 2015 01:35:35 GMT
title: Cannot get API version detail of v2.1

comments.content:
We can get version ids v2.0 and v2.1 by "get list of versions" like

$ curl -g -i -X GET http://192.168.11.65:8774
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json
Content-Length: 375
Date: Fri, 04 Sep 2015 01:32:25 GMT

{"versions": [{"status": "SUPPORTED", "updated": "2011-01-21T11:33:21Z", "links": [{"href": "http://192.168.11.65:8774/v2/", "rel": "self"}], "min_version": "", "version": "", "id": "v2.0"}, {"status": "CURRENT", "updated": "2013-07-23T11:33:21Z", "links": [{"href": "http://192.168.11.65:8774/v2.1/", "rel": "self"}], "min_version": "2.1", "version": "2.11", "id": "v2.1"}]}
$

and we can get v2.0 version details like:

    $ curl -g -i -X GET http://192.168.11.65:8774/v2.0
    HTTP/1.1 300 Multiple Choices
    Content-Type: application/json
    Content-Length: 453
    Date: Fri, 04 Sep 2015 01:33:36 GMT

    {"choices": [{"status": "SUPPORTED", "media-types": [{"base": "application/json", "type": "application/vnd.openstack.compute+json;version=2"}], "id": "v2.0", "links": [{"href": "http://192.168.11.65:8774/v2/v2.0", "rel": "self"}]}, {"status": "CURRENT", "media-types": [{"base": "application/json", "type": "application/vnd.openstack.compute+json;version=2.1"}], "id": "v2.1", "links": [{"href": "http://192.168.11.65:8774/v2.1/v2.0", "rel": "self"}]}]}


but we cannot get v2.1 version details

    $ curl -g -i -X GET http://192.168.11.65:8774/v2.1
    HTTP/1.1 401 Unauthorized
    Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
    Content-Length: 23
    Www-Authenticate: Keystone uri='http://192.168.11.65:5000'
    X-Compute-Request-Id: req-e6748244-59dc-45c7-9b27-8d00c5918df7
    Date: Fri, 04 Sep 2015 01:34:22 GMT

    Authentication required

even if passing auth, we cannot get anything

    $ curl -g -i -X GET http://192.168.11.65:8774/v2.1 -H "X-Auth-Token: ef3ac6beb4904072bca41111f45ea4f9"
    HTTP/1.1 302 Found
    Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf8
    Location: http://192.168.11.65:8774/v2.1/
    X-Compute-Request-Id: req-2c38f680-cd51-45a0-bd04-47e3b09ff9e8
    Content-Length: 0
    Date: Fri, 04 Sep 2015 01:35:35 GMT
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~oomichi

comments.content:
@Kenichi-san,

Try:
curl -g -i -X GET http://192.168.11.65:8774/v2.1/ -H "X-Auth-Token: ef3ac6beb4904072bca41111f45ea4f9"

Instead of:
curl -g -i -X GET http://192.168.11.65:8774/v2.1 -H "X-Auth-Token: ef3ac6beb4904072bca41111f45ea4f9"

See the '/' at the end of the URL. that should work.

There's a test case as well for this. The /v2.1 should give you a 302 with Location http header and the /v2.1/ should give you the correct payload. The test case is here:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_versions.py#L437
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dims-v

comments.content:
Hi Dims-san,

Thanks for your investigation.
Yeah, this report is invalid.

I faced this problem on my development env and reported this.
After that, I tried to reproduce this problem on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/220392/ , but I could not reproduce.
So maybe my previous test way was wrong.
Sorry about that.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~oomichi
